treatment: Strict isolation with intensive intravenous fluid therapy; antiemetics; antibiotics to prevent secondary infections; and high-calorie nutritional support under veterinary supervision.
Supportive care including hydration therapy; pain management; use of humidifier for respiratory congestion; and regular cleaning of eye and nasal discharge.
No curative treatment available once symptoms appear; immediate quarantine; euthanasia if required; and mandatory reporting to public health authorities.
Long-term supportive care with antiviral and immunomodulatory therapy; high-protein diet; stress reduction; and routine monitoring for secondary infections.
Veterinarian-prescribed antiparasitic medications; medicated sulfur or benzoyl peroxide shampoos; treatment of all in-contact animals; and environmental decontamination.
Supportive treatment including fluids; antipyretics; antibiotics for secondary infections; anticonvulsants if neurological signs are present; and strict isolation.
Aggressive fluid therapy; broad-spectrum antibiotics; anti-nausea medications; nutritional support; and strict hygiene to prevent viral spread.
Rest; cough suppressants; antibiotics if bacterial infection is suspected; nebulization; and isolation from other dogs until recovery.
Supportive care with hydration; steam therapy; nasal cleaning; appetite stimulants; and antibiotics if bacterial involvement is confirmed.
Long-term antibiotic therapy such as doxycycline; supportive care; tick control measures; and regular blood parameter monitoring.
Topical or systemic antiparasitic medications; thorough ear cleaning; and treatment of all pets in the household to prevent reinfestation.
Clipping and cleaning of affected area; topical antiseptics; anti-inflammatory medications; antibiotics if infection is present; and addressing underlying causes.
Topical antifungal treatments; oral antifungals in severe cases; environmental disinfection; and isolation to prevent transmission.
Pain management with NSAIDs; joint supplements; weight management; physiotherapy; and controlled exercise routines.
Renal-support diet; fluid therapy; blood pressure management; phosphate binders; and routine monitoring of kidney function.
